content.p: A billboard may only be permitted in urban areas of minimum control and in urban areas of partial control.
Any application for the display of or altering of a billboard must, where applicable, be accompanied by an environmental impact assessment.

intro.p: A billboard may not have-

content.p: an overall height in excess of 7m in landscape format or 15m in portrait format above the surface of the natural ground level; and
have an area in excess of 81 m² in the case of ground signs.

intro.p: A billboard must-

content.p: be spaced at least 120m; 200m or 300m apart on a road or freeway, where the speed limit is less than 60km/h, between 61-80km/h or greater than 81 km/h respectively;
not be erected within a distance of 50m from the nearest edge of an intersection on a lower order road and 100m from the nearest edge of an intersection on an arterial road;

not be erected within a distance of 100m; 200m, 250m or 300m from any ramp gore and any yellow line break point at an interchange where the speed limit is equal to or less than 60km/h; between 61-80km/h; between 81-100km/h or greater than 100km/h respectively; and
not be erected within 50m; 100m or 200m from any road sign where a speed limit has been imposed which is equal to or less than 60km/h; between 61-80km/h or greater than 81 km/h respectively.
A billboard may be permitted for a period of five years in urban areas of minimum control and in urban areas of partial control subject to conditions which may be imposed by the Municipality.

Upon expiry of a permit granted for the display of a billboard, the permit holder has three months prior to the date of expiry to re-apply for a permit, failing which the permit to display lapses on date of expiry.

intro.p: Any billboard displayed or altered must-

content.p: comply with any other applicable law;
not be detrimental to the nature of the environment in which it is located by reason of scale, intensity of illumination or design;
not partially or wholly obscure any approved outdoor advertising sign previously erected and legally displayed;
not constitute a danger to any person or property;
not encroach over the boundary line of the property on which it is erected;
not be erected if considered by an organ of state to be a distraction to drivers, cyclists or pedestrians which could contribute to unsafe traffic conditions;
not have red, amber or green as its main colours when it is located at signalised traffic intersections;
not obscure or interfere with any road traffic light or sign;

not constitute a road safety hazard or cause undue disturbance or where permitted to be illuminated if such illumination, in the opinion of Municipality, constitutes a road safety hazard or causes undue disturbance; and

not impede traffic flow on public roads during their display and maintenance, unless prior permission from the Municipality has been obtained and the necessary precautions have been taken and arranged.
A billboard may have a maximum of eight bits of information and a minimum lettering height of 500mm.
The application number for the billboard must be displayed in a visible area on the sign.
All non-locality bound billboards must be clearly identified in terms of ownership.
The billboard must where applicable display the name of the advertising company who is the lessee of immovable property on which the billboard is displayed.
A non-locality bound flat sign may only be permitted on blank return and back walls that have no sections which may be opened or that compromise any architectural features of the building.
Ground signs may be permitted in all areas of control.

A remote, non-locality bound ground sign which does not have an overall height in excess of 8m above the ground at any point nor dimensions which exceed 6m in length and 3m in height, and a total area of 18m² per face, shall be deemed to be of appropriate dimensions.

intro.p: Only one on-site, locality bound, freestanding ground sign per street facing side of the property may be permitted where-

content.p: it is necessary to facilitate the location of the entrance or access to a business premises;
it is not reasonably possible to affix appropriate signs to the building;
the business premises is so set back as to make proper visibility of signs on the building not feasible; or
the existence of a freestanding composite sign may prevent the proliferation of signage.

intro.p: An on-site, locality bound freestanding ground sign in the form of a business sign and tower structure may be permitted in terms of the National Building Regulations and applicable laws, provided that no such sign may-

content.p: exceed 7m in overall height;
have a clear height of less than 2,4m, excluding service facility signs and free standing composite signs;
exceed 12m² (measured as total height × total width of the advertising structure) when such sign is a combination sign;
be restricted to one such sign per site per street frontage or as otherwise permitted at the Municipality's discretion; and
contain advertising matter other than exclusively directional on more than 50% of the area of any face thereof.

A ground sign with dimensions which exceed those contemplated in subsection (2) shall not be erected unless, in the opinion of the Municipality, such sign screens premises which detract or are likely to detract from the amenities of the neighbourhood by reason of their appearance or the use to which they are put.
A non-locality sign which is a billboard may be displayed for a maximum of five years.
A locality bound sign may be displayed for a period as specified in the permit.
This class of sign includes service facility signs, such as those displayed at filling stations.
Any area between a ground sign and the street line shall be grassed or otherwise ornamented at the expense of the applicant and to the satisfaction of the Municipality.
Ground signs shall include project boards and development boards.

intro.p: Development boards may be-

content.p: a maximum of 18m² in size; and
displayed for a maximum of 24 months.
If a development takes longer than 24 months to complete, a new application for the display of a development board must be submitted.

intro.p: The following information must be displayed on a minimum of 50% of development boards while the picture of the development shall take up the rest of the space:

content.p: name and type of development;
developer's details;
opening date;
estate agents' details; and
on-show details.
Flat signs are permitted in all areas of control. Only locality bound and on-site flat signs shall be permitted to be displayed.
Applications for remote flat signs which exceed 36m² must be accompanied by an environmental impact assessment and an approved building plan for the structure.

The maximum projection of any part of a flat sign shall be 180mm where the underside of such sign measures less than 2,4m from a footway or pathway immediately below it, and the maximum projection shall be 300mm where the underside of such sign measures more than 2,4m above such footway or ground level.
A flat sign may not exceed 54m² in total area or exceed 50% of the visible wall surface area to which they are attached, affixed or painted, whichever is the lesser.
On-site, locality bound flat signs shall be permitted to be attached to the front, side and back walls of a building.
A flat sign shall not extend beyond the ends of the wall to which it is attached in any direction.
A flat sign may not cover any windows or other external openings of a building or obstruct the view from such openings.
Only one flat sign per enterprise per wall may be permitted by the Municipality.
A locality bound sign may be displayed for a period as specified in the permit.
A locality bound flat sign may not contain advertising matter other than exclusively directional on more than 50% of the area of any face thereof.
A flat sign displayed in urban landscapes of partial to maximum control may not exceed 50% of the visible wall surface area.
Any outdoor advertising sign, including its supports and frameworks, closer than 1.5m to an opening of a building must be constructed of non-combustible material in accordance with SANS 10400-T.

Any sign which is attached to a building of the height set out in Column 1 of Table 1 below, shall be so situated that no part of such sign has a depth greater than that set out in Column 2. For the purpose of such Table, the height of the building shall be measured as its vertical height above the ground at the point where the sign is to be erected.

td.p: Exceeding 17 m but not exceeding 34 m
Exceeding 34 m but not exceeding 43 m

content.p: In calculating the depth of any sign in accordance with the above Table, signs placed one above the other in the same vertical plane on the same building, or tier of that building, shall be deemed to be one sign, whether or not such signs belong to different owners or are displayed under separate permits.
Projecting signs may be permitted in areas of partial and minimum control.
Projecting signs may have a maximum thickness of 300mm.
The minimum clear height of a projecting sign shall be 2,4m.
Projecting signs may not extend beyond the ends of the wall to which it is attached.
Projecting signs must have a minimum clearance of 450mm from the edge of a roadway and 1,5m from any overhead electricity wires or cables.

intro.p: The maximum projection of a sign may be-

content.p: 1,5m in the case of a projecting sign which has a clear height of more than 7,5m; or
1m where the sign has a clear height of less than 7,5m.
Projecting signs must be installed at right angles to the street facade or to the direction of oncoming traffic.
A projecting sign may not be displayed within 5m of any other projecting sign displayed on the same building.
Only one projecting sign per enterprise per street-facing is permitted.
A projecting sign shall be permitted for the duration of the business.
A projecting sign may not be displayed where a business is no longer in operation.
All projecting signs must be locality bound.
Projecting signs may not contain advertising matter other than exclusively directional on more than 50% of the area of any face thereof.
Letters on a projecting sign must be written horizontally.
Any outdoor advertising sign, including its supports and frameworks, closer than 1.5m to an opening of a building must be constructed of non-combustible material in accordance with SANS 10400-T.
Roof signs may only be permitted in harbour and industrial zones, and in commercial zones below road level.
The maximum permitted size of a roof sign shall depend on the area of the specific roof, the character of the building and a consideration of the urban and streetscape as a whole.

Roof signs must be placed in such a manner so as not to interfere with the run-off of rainwater from the roof of the building or impede any building feature, element or component that relies on the direct exposure to solar radiation for its proper functioning.

Roof signs must be thoroughly secured and anchored to the building on or over which they are to be erected and all structural loads shall be safely distributed to the structural members of the building without the use of guys, stays or other restraining devices.

A roof or sky sign, including all its supports and framework, shall be constructed entirely of non-combustible materials approved by the Municipality and if illuminated, shall not be placed on or over the roof of any building unless such sign, as well as the entire roof construction, is constructed of non-combustible material.
Locality bound roof signs may be permitted with the consent of the Municipality.
Roof signs may not obstruct the view or affect the amenity of any other building.

Roof signs shall not contain advertising matter other than locality bound roof signs. A locality bound roof sign may not have more than 50% of the area of the face of the sign containing advertising matter.
A roof sign may not be used for third party advertising.
A sky sign may only be displayed in areas of minimum or partial control and in special advertising zones with the specific consent of the Municipality.
A sky sign may not project in front of a main wall of a building so as to extend beyond the roof of such building in any direction.
A sky sign may not obstruct the view of or affect the amenity of any other building.

A sky sign must be placed in such a manner so as not to interfere with the run-off of rainwater from the roof of the building or impede any building feature, element or component that relies on the direct exposure to solar radiation for its proper functioning.
Additional remote advertising signs may not be erected on a building where approval for the display of a sky sign has been granted.
A locality bound sign may be displayed for a period as specified in the permit.

A sky sign must be properly secured and anchored to the building on or over which it is to be erected and all structural loads shall be safely distributed to the structural members of the building without the use of guys, stays or other restraining devices.

A sky sign, including all its supports and framework, shall be constructed entirely of non-combustible materials approved by the Municipality and if illuminated, may not be placed on or over the roof of any buildings unless such sign, as well as the entire roof construction, is constructed of non-combustible material.
The content of a sky sign is limited to advertising for branding purposes and the display of advertising campaigns is prohibited.
All applications for the display of a sky sign must be accompanied by an engineer's certificate.
An engineer's certificate must be submitted to the Municipality within five days of completion of the structure.

attachment.heading: Schedule 8
attachment.subheading: Veranda, balcony, canopy and under-awning signs

content.p: Veranda, balcony, canopy and under-awning signs are permitted in all areas of control.

intro.p: An under-awning sign suspended below the roof of a veranda, canopy or balcony must-

content.p: be 1,8m in length, 610mm in height and 300mm in thickness;
have a minimum thickness of 100mm; and
have a minimum height of 2,4m above the pavement, footpath or street.
A sign may be affixed flat on to or painted on a parapet wall, beam or fascia of a veranda or balcony.
A sign may not be allowed on or over architectural features of buildings, and may not cover any window or obstruct the view from any such opening or detract from the aesthetics of the building.

intro.p: A sign contemplated in item 3 (1) may not-

content.p: exceed 1m in height;
project beyond any of the extremities of the surface to which it is affixed;
project more than 300mm in front of the surface to which it is affixed; and
extend within 450mm of the edge of a roadway unless the clear height of such sign is a minimum of 3.7m.
Only one sign per enterprise per street-facing is permitted.
Signs will be permitted for the duration of the enterprise.

intro.p: An under-awning sign suspended below the roof of a veranda, canopy or balcony must-

content.p: have its axis of symmetry at right angles to the street line;
be centralised within the width of the veranda or canopy to which it is attached;
be allowed with a minimum spacing of 3m centre to centre between signs;
not other than on an exclusively directional sign contain more than 50% advertising matter of the area of any face thereof; and
be designed, supervised and certified by an engineer.

A sun-blind and awning must be constructed and fixed in such a manner as to be incapable of being lowered to less than 2,5m above the footway or pavement directly beneath it. Such signs must be parallel to the building line and may not interfere with vehicular or pedestrian traffic, traffic lights or traffic signs.
A sign must not be displayed above the lower edge of any visible second-floor window.
Any outdoor advertising sign, including its supports and frameworks, closer than 1.5m to an opening of a building must be constructed of non-combustible material in accordance with SANS 10400-T.
Posters, banners and flags are permitted in all areas of control.

intro.p: Any person who displays a poster, banner or flag advertisement to be displayed must ensure that-
any advertisement relating to an election, meeting, function or event must-

content.p: be of maximum A1 in size;
have a clear height of minimum 2,4m; and
be securely fixed to durable hardboard, approved backing board or any other material, frame or fixing as approved by the Municipality; and
in the case of private property, where the event, function or meeting is taking place, the maximum size of a banner shall be 6m².
There must be a minimum of 120m spacing between posters for the same event.
No posters are permitted to be displayed on bridges, traffic lights, traffic signs (includes supporting structure for such signs), natural features, trees, freeways, or national roads.
No posters are permitted to be displayed on roads with a speed limit in excess of 60km/h.

Any advertisement relating to an election, meeting, function or event may not be placed in such a manner that the content of separate advertisements when read in succession forms a continuous relative legend.
The positioning of posters and pole banners is restricted to electricity lamp standards and must not obscure any municipal signs such as traffic signs attached to the lamp.
Temporary advertisements may not be displayed on any national roads, highways, freeways and other areas as identified by the Municipality from time to time.
Any person displaying any poster advertisement relating to a election, meeting, function or event shall be permitted one poster per electricity lamp-post.
A maximum of two event posters, one street-pole banner or one poster is permitted per pole for two unrelated events.
Posters may have a maximum of 15 bits of information excluding logos.
Banners may have a maximum of 8 bits of information including logos.
A poster may not be displayed for more than 14 days prior to commencement of the event and must be removed within the stipulated period provided for in the permit.
The provisions contained in subsection (1) do not apply to election posters.

intro.p: Every person intending to display or erect any temporary advertisement or sign, for which the prior written permission of the Municipality is required, shall submit a written application to the Municipality, which shall be accompanied by the following:

content.p: proof of advertisement to which the application relates, prior to printing, and
a distribution list of the streets in which the advertisement is to be displayed.
Commercial advertising on an event poster may not occupy more than 10% of the surface of the advertisement and must be displayed at the bottom of the poster.
Every poster for which permission is granted shall visibly display the Municipality's sticker or marking and the Municipality shall be entitled to retain one such poster for identification purposes.
Posters erected on Electricity Poles are subject to removal for maintenance work as and when necessary, and no notice is required to be given for their removal.
Aerial advertisements may be permitted in all areas of control.
An aerial advertisement may not exceed 36m² in size.
No aerial advertisement may be flown at a height of more than 45m from the surface or ground.
Only one aerial advertisement is permitted per event.
An aerial advertisement may only be displayed for the duration of the event.
An engineer must provide a certificate confirming that the structure and tethering is suitable for display of the aerial advertisement.
The engineer's certificate contemplated in subsection (1) must accompany the applicant's application to display the sign.

intro.p: Any written application for the display of an aerial advertisement must be accompanied by the following, where applicable:

content.p: particulars of the content and dimensions of the aerial advertisement and of the aerial device by means of which the advertisement is to be displayed;
particulars of the materials used and method of construction and anchorage;

particulars of the intended location with a description of the premises to which the aerial device will be anchored or tethered and details of electricity and telephone poles and cables and other structures within 30m or length of tether, whichever is the greater, of the point of anchorage;
the name and address of the person/s or contractor/s displaying the aerial advertisement and the name and address of the approved competent person in attendance of the aerial device and of its owner;
the period and times of intended display;
written consent by the owner for such anchoring, where the applicant is not the owner of the premises to which the aerial device is to be anchored or tethered;
proof of the provision of an automatic deflation device;
adequate public liability insurance to the Municipality's satisfaction;
approval by and any conditions or requirements determined by the national Civil Aviation authority; and
an engineer's certificate.

Aerial advertisements shall be permitted for events of a sporting, civic, cultural or political nature only and shall not be displayed or caused to be displayed on, from or over Municipal property, including any street or public place.
Advertising vehicles are permitted in all areas of control.
The advertising panel or portion of the vehicle used for transit advertising shall be a total of 18m² per panel and a maximum of eight bits is permitted per panel.
An advertising vehicle may not be placed or parked on any property in a manner where it is visible from a public place.
An advertising vehicle parked on private property for the purpose of storage must be positioned in such a manner as not to be visible from any public road or public place.
The Municipality may identify Municipal property where the parking or placement of advertising vehicles may be permitted.
A permit to display may be granted for a maximum period of one year.
The safety conditions as contained in section 27 of the By-law apply.

intro.p: Every application for the display of an advertising vehicle must be accompanied by-

content.p: particulars of the materials of which the advertising sign is made, its dimensions, the manner of its construction and the method by which it is secured to the advertising vehicle;

the name, address and telephone number of the owner of the vehicle or, if the owner resides or has his or her place of business outside the boundaries of the eThekwini Municipal area, of the person having control of the vehicles at all times;
a copy of the current vehicle licence and registration certificate issued in respect of such vehicles, as required in terms of the National Road Traffic Act, and
public liability insurance in the Municipality's favour for a minimum of R2,5 million.
An application for flags on-site on commercial property may be considered for properties which are in areas of minimum control and partial control.
The minimum sizes of flags must be in accordance with the national standards for national flags on flag-poles.
Flags on-site may be attached to a building or boundary wall, but may not encroach on Municipal property.
The length of a pole attached to a building may not exceed 2 m in length.
An on-site flag attached to a flag-staff must have a minimum ground clearance of 2,5m and the pole must not exceed 4m in height.
A maximum of four flags displaying the name of the business which are street-facing may be permitted to be displayed.

Flags must be constructed of durable PVC materials, and where applicable flags must be constructed of materials in accordance with SANS 1010, and the flag-pole must be resistant to rust and corrosion.
All flag-faces must be secured so that they may not be caused to be blown by the wind to the extent that they become detached from the pole.

attachment.heading: Schedule 13
attachment.subheading: Estate agent's boards and contractor's boards

content.p: Estate agent's boards are permitted in all areas of control.
Estate agent boards must be placed within a distance as determined by the Municipality from the boundary of the property or the perimeter fence.

intro.p: The number of estate agent's boards permitted per property street frontage are as follows:

content.p: area of maximum and partial control- a maximum of two signs per residential property where there is more than one agent selling or leasing the property;
area of partial control (commercial)- a maximum of three signs per commercial property where there is more than one agent selling or leasing the property; and
area of minimum control (industrial)- each agent to have only one sign on the perimeter fence where there is more than one agent selling or leasing the property.
A residential property real estate agent is permitted one estate agent's boards per property per street-facing in respect of "For Sale/For Rent" signs if there is more than one selling agent.
A maximum of four estate agent's boards may be displayed to direct members of the public to a property "on show".
An "on show" estate agent's board may be displayed from 13h00 on a Saturday and must be removed before 09H00 on the following Monday.
A maximum of four contractors boards are permitted per site.

section.heading: Duration of display of estate agent's board

content.p: An estate agent's board must be removed within 30 days from date of sale or leasing of property to which it relates.

Estate Agents must be registered with the Development Management's General Advertising Branch of the Municipality in accordance with the provisions of this By-law and shall be issued with a permit valid for a period of 12 months.
A commercial real estate agents' board may only state "For Rent", "To Let" "For Sale"; or "On Auction".
A commercial property board must be a maximum of 2m² in size.
A residential property board may only be 0.552m² in size.
A contractor's board may not be less than 0.9m² or exceed 1.5m² in size.

intro.p: A ground sign displayed by a commercial property estate agent may not-

content.p: exceed 4m in height;
exceed 3m² in size;
be displayed on vacant land without consent having been obtained from the owner;
contain photographs of the agent; and
be positioned outside the boundaries of the vacant land which is for sale.
An estate agent may only display one free-standing board per street face.

attachment.heading: Schedule 14
attachment.subheading: Community Policing Forum (CPF) and Conservancy Signs

content.p: Community Policing Forum and Conservancy Signs are permitted in all areas of control in a public place situated at or close to a Police Station.
The maximum height of a ground sign may only be 4m and the face of the ground sign may only be 1.5m × 1m.
CPF boards may be positioned on Municipal property subject to their location not creating a safety or health hazard.
Banners and flags are only permitted inside the perimeter fence of the venue on the day of a meeting of the CPF or conservancy and are exempt from application fees.
A CPF or conservancy ground sign is limited to one ground sign per street or road frontage.
An approval of CPF or conservancy signs may only be granted for maximum of five years.
The structure and face of the ground sign may not be illuminated.

intro.p: An application for permission to display a CPF or conservancy sign must be made by the chairperson of the CPF or Conservancy, and the application must include a-

content.p: motivation letter by the chairperson;
letter from the Station commander of the South African Police Service or a letter confirming the status of the conservancy from the Deputy-Head: Environmental Management; and
proposed site or position which must be approved by the eThekwini Traffic Authority.
Only 30% area of the sign board may be reserved for sponsorships.
The telephone number, logo and website address of the CPF or conservancy must be displayed on the ground sign.

attachment.heading: Schedule 15
attachment.subheading: Signs at stadia and sports grounds

content.p: Locality bound signs are permitted in all areas of control.

The size and types of signs permitted at stadia will be determined by environmental factors such as traffic, land use and visual impact of the area where the stadium or public sports ground is located.
The appropriateness of the position may be determined by the sign's environmental impact and the provisions of the By-law.
One type of sign per street facing is permitted.
Signs in stadia may be displayed for a period not exceeding five years.
A temporary sign may only be displayed if the Stadium Management has obtained written permission from the Municipality and such signs may only be displayed for the duration of the event.
The safety conditions as contained in section 27 of the By-law apply.

intro.p: The following classes of permanent signs will be considered at stadia, and include:

content.p: ground signs;
wall signs;
fascia signs; and
National and Sports Affiliation Flags.
Temporary signs may be considered for use within the premises of the venue while an event is taking place and includes but is not limited to, inflatable signs, banners and flags.
Signs at schools are permitted in all areas of control.
A school must submit an application to the Municipality where it intends to display signs where the total areas of the signs exceed 12m².
A sponsor's content on all permitted signs may not exceed 50% on signs which display the school's name.
A suitable position for a sign will be determined by the Municipality and will be a condition of approval for a permit.
One billboard of a maximum size of 18m² will be permitted per school subject to the requirements of the display of a billboard.
One ground sign may be permitted per street-face.
All sponsored signs and billboards are permitted to be displayed for a maximum of five years.
The supporting structures of ground signs must be padded and raised 3m from the ground.
Branding may be permissible on the padding contemplated in subsection (1).
Any outdoor advertising sign, including its supports and frameworks, closer than 1.5m to an opening of a building must be constructed of non-combustible material in accordance with SANS 10400-T.
All signs displayed must be cladded according to Municipal specifications.
An application for the display of signs at schools must be signed by the person with the applicable authority.
Sponsor signs which display only the sponsor's content must face within the school premises.
An application for the display of a sponsor sign must be accompanied by a copy of the contract entered into between the school and the sponsor.
A school may apply for the display of a fifty-fifty sign on a wall which permit is renewable every five years.
Home business signs are permitted in all areas of control and an application for a home business sign must be made where the proposed sign is in excess of 0.6m².
One sign, per street frontage premises on which a home business is conducted.
A home business sign may not be illuminated.
The home business sign must be strictly on the boundary of the property.
One sign per street frontage premises on which a home business is conducted is permitted.
A permit is valid for the duration of the validity period of a Consent Use Approval from the Development Planning Department.
The safety conditions as contained in section 27 of this By-law apply.
The Municipality may consider an application for a home business sign to be painted on the premises perimeter walls, subject to conditions.
Home businesses are required to obtain planning, building or any other applicable approvals from the Municipality before displaying any signs on their premises.
Each sign may display the name of the business, address and contact details and a maximum of eight bits of information is permitted.

intro.p: The following types of signs may not be displayed:

content.p: free-standing signs;
illuminated signs;
signs with moving parts;
electronic signs;
banners;
flags;
projecting signs;
canopy and under-awning signs;
project replica signs;
inflatable signs; and
wrapping of trees on Municipal property.
A mural may only be permitted in areas of minimum and partial control.
The size of a mural shall be determined by the dimension of the wall and the mural may not exceed 50% of the area.
The sign or mural must be displayed on the wall of the building.
The mural is permitted to be displayed for a maximum of five years.
The safety conditions as contained in section 27 of this By-law apply.
A mural may only be displayed on buildings which are used for office, commercial or social facility purposes.
